.
"I am inspired by her flexibility and commitment to growth. This year she has taken on an entirely new role in the self contained classroom. When confronted with challenges she reaches out to her team to collaborate and problem solve. She never gives up on kids and is willing to try any and all ideas brought to the table/think outside the box. She values the success of the whole student, academically and socially emotionally."
.
Congrats Ms. Debes!

They applied their understanding of the geologic forces in the Earth to figure out how places were created and to predict how they may look in the future if the Earth keeps changing the way that it is.
The students got to select what they would create: a 3D model, a poster, a comic/graphic novel, or a video. The projects were put on display in the MPR and younger grades had the amazing opportunity to learn from our 8th graders! #inspire70

post_text: This week and next (Nov. 27- Dec. 7) Student Council will be holding the annual Park View Food Drive. It's a very special tradition. Let‚Äôs see if we can help even more this year! New this year...if you are not able to bring in an item on the list, but instead would like to donate $1.00, this money will be given to the Fire Department on pick-up day, so that they can use the the funds to shop for holiday food and items to donate. Please see photo below for grade level donation suggestions. #inspire70
